name.value: Dispense as Written (DAW) Product Selection Code

title.value: Dispense as Written (DAW) Product Selection Code

description.value: This field indicates the prescriber's instruction regarding substitution of generic equivalents or order to dispense the specific prescribed medication. Part D plans generally require pharmacies to use generics or the least expensive version of the prescribed drug. However, there are times when a prescriber intends for the beneficiary to receive the drug exactly as it is written on the prescription (e.g., to get the brand-name version of a drug). When there are specific instructions from the prescriber, it is indicated in this variable with a value of 1 or greater. Source: https://bluebutton.cms.gov/resources/variables/daw_prod_slctn_cd

display.value: No Product Selection Indicated (may also have missing values)

definition.value: No Product Selection Indicated (may also have missing values)

display.value: Substitution Allowed - Patient Requested That Brand Product Be Dispensed

definition.value: Substitution Allowed - Patient Requested That Brand Product Be Dispensed

display.value: Substitution Allowed - Pharmacist Selected Product Dispensed

definition.value: Substitution Allowed - Pharmacist Selected Product Dispensed

display.value: Substitution Allowed - Generic Drug Not in Stock

definition.value: Substitution Allowed - Generic Drug Not in Stock

display.value: Substitution Allowed - Brand Drug Dispensed as Generic

definition.value: Substitution Allowed - Brand Drug Dispensed as Generic

display.value: Substitution Not Allowed - Brand Drug Mandated by Law

definition.value: Substitution Not Allowed - Brand Drug Mandated by Law

display.value: Substitution Allowed - Generic Drug Not Available in Marketplace

definition.value: Substitution Allowed - Generic Drug Not Available in Marketplace
